meanings.definition: Move or run somewhere suddenly or rapidly.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit darted across the field.
meanings.sent2: She darted out of the room when she heard the loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel darted up the tree when it saw the dog approaching.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes darted around the room, searching for her lost keys.
meanings.sent5: The fish darted away as soon as it sensed danger.

meanings.definition: To shoot or launch something quickly and suddenly.
meanings.sent1: He darted a quick glance at the clock before the meeting started.
meanings.sent2: The soccer player darted the ball towards the goal with precision.
meanings.sent3: The chef darted a sprinkle of salt into the boiling pot.
meanings.sent4: The archer darted arrows at the target with great accuracy.
meanings.sent5: She darted a smile at her friend across the room.

meanings.definition: To glance or look quickly and suddenly.
meanings.sent1: The child darted a curious look at the strange object.
meanings.sent2: She darted a quick glance at her watch during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent3: The cat darted a suspicious look at the new visitor.
meanings.sent4: His eyes darted around the room, trying to find the source of the noise.
meanings.sent5: The student darted a hopeful look at the teacher before the exam.
